column1: Guthláf was the banner-bearer of King Théoden of Rohan.
He rode to the relief of Minas Tirith with his Lord in the War of the Ring
column2: and there fought in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields
column3: where he was slain.  He fell with the banner in his hand
column4: and it had to be taken from him after death to be given to Éomer.  He also earned himself a mention in the Song of the Mounds of Mundburg.

column1: In Old English Guþláf means "survivor of the battle" (consisting of Wiktionary:guþ#Old_English + Wiktionary:laf#Old_English).Robert Foster
2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:

:Guthláf can be found at the lumber camp in the Eastfold area of the West Rohan region. He is the son of Thane Sparhafoc of Fenmark. He has been dismissed from his duty as Theodens banner-bearer by Gríma
column2: but he is expecting to be returned to the kings service soon.
